intro: Matelea planiflora, commonly known as the flatleaf matelea, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features delicate, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white, with five petals and a distinctive spurred structure. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, adapted to arid environments. Matelea planiflora is typically found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
